alert.note: Alert for East Portion of the Olympic Mountains; West Portion of the Olympic Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 20 at 9:25AM PDT until August 20 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR HOT, DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 652 AND 661... The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a Red Flag Warning for hot, dry and unstable conditions, which is in effect until 8 PM PDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 652 West Portion of the Olympic Mountains and Fire Weather Zone 661 East Portion of the Olympic Mountains. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 70s. * HAINES...Mid-level Haines Index 6 or high potential for large plume dominated fire growth. * IMPACTS...A dry and unstable air mass with warm temperatures can contribute to active fire behavior. In western Washington, significant growth on existing fires takes place under such conditions. If a fire were to begin, air quality may diminish in the surrounding area.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either imminent or occurring now. Any fires that develop will likely spread quickly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.

area.areaDesc: East Portion of the Olympic Mountains; West Portion of the Olympic Mountains
